title: Multimedia Instructional Design for Understanding Phase Changes and Solubility

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of general chemistry foundational theories (atoms, molecules, chemical bonding, etc.)
context.additional_context: Acquiring teaching methodologies and animation utilization strategies for pre-service teachers to effectively teach chemistry concepts

learning_goals: Can animate explanations of the three states of matter (solid, liquid, gas) and molecular-level changes
Can analyze and explain the effects of thermal energy on phase changes using visual materials
Explore solution formation processes and solubility factors (temperature, pressure, solvent-solute interactions) through animation-based activities
Can design effective science teaching strategies utilizing multimedia learning resources
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
